text.text: `*ConfigFile*` to be replaced with the actual configfile

• `/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra start`
 • `/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra stop`
• `/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra restart`
 • `/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra status`
 • `/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra wait_for_ready`

`Note` Cassandra must be running to take backup.

• Creates a tar file of the following directories and files
		a. Directories
			• /opt/apigee/data/apigee-cassandra
			• /opt/apigee/etc/apigee-cassandra.d
		b. Files if they exist
			• /opt/apigee/token/application/apigee-cassandra.properties
			• /opt/apigee/customer/application/apigee-cassandra.properties
			• /opt/apigee/customer/defaults.sh
			• /opt/apigee/customer/conf/license.txt
		c. Creates a .tar.gz file in the /opt/apigee/backup/apigee-cassandra directory. The file name has the following form:
			`backup-year.month.day,hour.min.seconds.tar.gz`
			For example:
			`backup-2018.05.29,11.13.42.tar.gz`
To restore a component from a backup file:

• Stop the component
		To refer the stop command
		Run `@super_bot doc cs service`
• Ensure that the following directories are empty
		a. Directories
			• /opt/apigee/data/apigee-cassandra
			• /opt/apigee/etc/apigee-cassandra.d
		b. If they are not empty, delete their contents using commands like the following:
			• `rm -rf /opt/apigee/data/apigee-cassandra/*`
			• `rm -rf /opt/apigee/data/apigee-cassandra.d/*`
• For example:
			`/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-cassandra restore backup-2018.05.29,11.13.42.tar.gz`
`*ConfigFile*` to be replaced with the actual configfile

			`backup-year.month.day,hour.min.seconds.tar.gz`
			For example:
			`backup-2018.05.29,11.13.42.tar.gz`
To restore a component from a backup file:

• Stop the component
		To refer the stop command
		Run `@super_bot doc zk service`
• Ensure that the following directories are empty
		a. Directories
			• /opt/apigee/data/apigee-zookeeper
			• /opt/apigee/etc/apigee-zookeeper.d
		b. If they are not empty, delete their contents using commands like the following:
			• `rm -rf /opt/apigee/data/apigee-zookeeper/*`
			• `rm -rf /opt/apigee/data/apigee-zookeeper.d/*`
• For example:
			`/opt/apigee/apigee-service/bin/apigee-service apigee-zookeeper restore backup-2018.05.29,11.13.42.tar.gz`

• For example:
